description: From Latin circumscrībō, from circum (“around”) + scrībō (“write”). Surface analysis: circum- +‎ scribe.

verbs.description: circumscribe (third-person singular simple present circumscribes, present participle circumscribing, simple past and past participle circumscribed)

entries.meaning: To draw a line around; to encircle.
(geometry) To draw the smallest circle or higher-dimensional sphere that has (a polyhedron, polygon, etc.) in its interior.
